results.title: Bill Onus boomerangs
results.brief_description: Yorta Yorta activist, artist and entrepreneur Bill Onus shared his culture as an act of resistance and reclamation of power. Through his factory and shop, Aboriginal Enterprises, he shared his art and culture, selling boomerangs and other pieces.
results.description:
Boomerang 2: handmade and painted with stylised image of an animal, and abstract decoration at each end. Reverse bears artist’s stamp.
*TO BE DISPLAYED ON REVERSE SHOWING ARTIST’S STAMP
description_for_label:

results.title: The Family Law Production stills
results.brief_description: Based on Benjamin Law’s 2010 book, The Family Law was the first Australian TV show to focus on an Asian Australian family. While it explores familiar stories about an everyday family, it offers a unique perspective on what it means to be Australian today.

details.label: Curatorial section
display_values: The Story of the Moving Image → Moving Australia → 11. Screen Australia Showcase

results.title: The CAAMA Group brochure
results.brief_description: In 1998, the Central Australian Aboriginal Media Association (CAAMA) launched the world’s first Indigenous owned and operated TV network, Imparja Television. Along with the establishment of Indigenous Community Television (ICTV) in 2001, these early initiatives paved the way for today’s broadcasters.

details.label: Curatorial section
display_values: The Story of the Moving Image → Moving Australia → 07. First Nations First → 04 Birth of Indigenous Broadcasting
